SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Block
A tile inside a mine that, when mined, gives the player coins.
Bomb
A type of block that when mined, causes the player to lose coins and removes adjacent blocks in the mine.
Chest
Block that when mined has a random chance to give the player a piece of equipment out of a pool of different equipment.
DrawingSurface
A surface that can draw and display things and play sounds
Equipment
Represents the equipment that the Gambledorf uses, with each piece of equipment having a different mine power value, and rarities
Gambledorf
A interactable character that can move up, down, left, and right, and mine blocks.
Gamblemine
Helps set up the gamblemine game
InventoryScreen
A screen where the tools of player is displayed The player can see and equip tools by clicking on the tool the mouse hovered over
MenuScreen
The starting screen where the player can start the game and go to the other screens.
MineScreen
The screen where the player is able to mine blocks Can get new tools when clicked on chest Can lose coins when clicked on bomb Can navigate to different screens
NormalMine
A normal mine that extends from MineScreen and that sets its unique characteristics
Rectangle
Circle uses the Processing library to model a circle.
RichMine
A rich mine that extends from MineScreen and that sets its unique characteristics
Screen
Ensures other screen subclasses have dimensions, and also allows each screen to have music and sound effects
ScreenSwitcher
Changes the screen from MenuScreen, StatsScreen, NormalMine, RichMine, and InventoryScreen.
Shape
This class represents an abstract Shape.
Sprite
Represents any object that moves and is affected by gravity
StatsScreen
The screen that displays all of the achivements of the player Such as numbers of chest, blocks, and bombs cracked The number of tools obtained The number of coins that the player got
